channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: To Many Ukrainians, U.S. Peace Plan Looks Like ‘Capitulation’
item.description: While the White House has cautioned that the proposal is still in “flux,” its contours reflect maximalist demands made by Russia throughout the war th...

item.title: After calling Mamdani a ‘100% Communist lunatic,’ Trump now says ‘we’re looking for the same things’
item.description: The Republican president and new Democratic star have indicated an openness to come together for the city they've both called home.

item.title: Transportation chief offers advice to increasingly angry Americans: ‘Let’s maybe go back to an era where we didn’t wear our pajamas to the airport’
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to ask people, 'Hey, let's maybe go back to an era where we didn't wear our pajamas to the airport.'"

item.title: Just 776 FAA employees will get Trump’s $10,000 bonus, but unions say thousands who worked during the shutdown were left out
item.description: The payments will be received no later than Dec. 9, the Federal Aviation Administration said.

item.title: The Fate of Google’s Ad Tech Monopoly Is Now in a Judge’s Hands
item.description: A judge queried lawyers about whether a breakup made sense during closing arguments on how to fix the tech giant’s dominance in online advertising.

item.title: Brazil hails ‘historic victory’ after months of pressure as Trump removes 40% tariffs on coffee imports
item.description: The President initially hiked tariffs in protest of the persecution of former President Jair Bolsonaro, who is imprisoned for attempting to stage a co...

item.title: European Leaders Back Zelensky After Trump’s Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan Excludes Them
item.description: A U.S.-Russian proposal would require Kyiv to give up territory and reduce its army. If Moscow complies with the terms, it could receive benefits incl...

item.title: As Trump Pushes on Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky’s Options Are Narrowing
item.description: The Ukrainian president’s options are narrowing as he is confronted with a 28-point proposal drafted by American and Russian envoys.

item.title: America Is Setting a Trap for Itself
item.description: The United States, not China, seems determined to upend the global order.

item.title: ‘We want to trust what we’ve heard’: Farmers remain unsettled on trade, even after China’s biggest U.S. soybean purchase in two years
item.description: China’s U.S. soybean haul has exceeded 1 million metric tons this month. Trump wants China to buy 12 million tons by the end of the year.

item.title: Survivors Describe Deadly Snowstorm in Chilean Patagonia
item.description: Five tourists, from Mexico, Britain and Germany, died Monday on a popular hiking trail in the Torres del Paine National Park.

item.title: Zelensky Faces a ‘Difficult Choice’ With Trump’s Proposed Plan
item.description: The Trump administration has proposed a 28-point peace plan designed to end the Russia-Ukraine war. President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that ...

item.title: As Trump Pushes on Russia-Ukraine Peace Plan, Zelensky’s Options Are Narrowing
item.description: The Ukrainian president’s options are narrowing as he is confronted with a 28-point proposal drafted by American and Russian envoys.

item.title: To Many Ukrainians, U.S. Peace Plan Looks Like ‘Capitulation’
item.description: While the White House has cautioned that the proposal is still in “flux,” its contours reflect maximalist demands made by Russia throughout the war th...
